column2: ?         MSc in microbiology or a related life-sciences field.         4+ years of experience performing microbiology testing for QC in a cGMP environment, ideally for vaccines in particular         Well-versed in media preparation, sterility testing, EMP monitoring, and personnel monitoring         Extensive experience in the microbial testing of water samples and in-process samples, as well as preservative efficacy studies and disinfectant validation         Experienced in the operation and validation of instruments like autoclaves, microscopes, cell counters, and particle counters         Experience with techniques for the identification of a broad spectrum of bio-contaminants, including bacteria and fungi         Experience with biowaste management, de-contamination, cleaning and DHS activities in a manner compliant with all relevant laws and regulations         Strong background in data management and analysis, with the ability to independently find, keep track of, and report on relevant trends in QC results         Experience planning and ensuring comprehensive and approriately-controlled sample collection for environmental monitoring such as via settle plates, and for MLT and pathogens via a variety of modalities, including water collection, area swabs, and personal monitoring such as finger-dabbing.         Deep knowledge of global guidelines on analytical method validation, US 21 CFR Part 11 compliance related to microbiology testing, and test plans to ensure data quality objectives         Experience working with outsourced testing providers for microbiology work, including understanding of the necessary documentation to provide to and receive from each such outsourced provider         Experience with investigations into OOS, OOL, OOT, and other types of quality incidents         Ability to maintain operational and GMP readiness of the QC areas         Exposure to and participation in regulatory audits, ideally for all of CDSCO/DCGI, WHO, and US FDA         Ability to conceptualize, write, follow, and train others on SOPs for QC testing using methods derived from both compendial and non-compendial sources         Experience dealing with change controls, devations, incident investigations, and other elements of quality management systems         Willingness to work any shift required, including night shifts, based on project requirements         Exceptional oral and written communication skills

column2: Dear Candidate,   We're seeking top talent like you to join  Steriscience ! We currently have an opening for the position of  Senior Executive - Microbiology  If you're an experienced pharmaceutical professional as lab supervisor in microbiology for sterile injectables and ready to make an impact, we want to hear from you.    Company:   Steriscience Specialties Pvt Ltd Website: https://steri-science.com/ Work Location:  Bilekhalli (Opposite to IIM), Bannerghatta Road,? Bangalore Qualification:  B.Sc./ M.Sc. (Microbiology) Experience:  5 - 11 years  ( experience should be in sterile Injectables/ Parenteral/ Vaccine/ Opthalmic) Background of job:  Working experience in regulated markets (sterile Injectable/ Parenteral/ Vaccine/Opthalmic) Department: Microbiology Designation:  Senior Executive  KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Supervise and ensure that team members perform all relevant duties listed in their individual key duties and responsibilities related to    Environmental monitoring. Compressed gas monitoring. Gowning qualification. Isolates identification. Calibration of sampling devices. Visual inspection of media-filled units. Aseptic practices during microbiology sampling and analysis. Trending and analysis. Qualification and training. Equipment qualification and training. Analyst qualification/requalification.  Review and approve (where applicable) all documents generated by individual team members and initiate necessary actions as per current procedures. Receive and discuss escalation of non-conformance and incidents with individual team members and initiate necessary action as per current procedures. Escalate any deviations and/or incidents logged to the head of the department for future assessment and actions. Ensure preventive maintenance, calibration, laboratory maintenance, and breakdown maintenance programs are reviewed as per current procedures. Review and approve SOPs/protocols/reports/incidents/investigations, change controls, CAPA, QRM, drawings/layouts, etc., as applicable, as required and assigned by supervisor. Facilitate or participate in the execution of relevant protocols in compliance with the requirements specified in the protocols and associated current procedures. Participate in self-inspection as part of compliance verification and ensure necessary corrective and preventive actions are initiated. Coordinate/facilitate and conduct training as scheduled and as per requirements. Prepare and review department-specific documents (SOPs, Protocols, Reports, QRMs, etc.) as per current procedures. Perform all relevant checks, verification, and oversight as prescribed in procedures and record them in relevant documents. Review and certify destruction of rejected, expired materials, and products as per current procedures. Review records/reports for completeness, accuracy, and data integrity elements. Review trends for completeness, accuracy, anelements. Participate in cross-functional discussions on matters related to quality & compliance. Undergo training for all identified procedures prior to performing relevant activities. Identify competency enhancement needs for team members and facilitate/conduct training as per requirements or as assigned by the supervisor. Promptly report any non-conformance and incidents observed. Follow safety instructions during all relevant activities. Carry out any other specific activity as assigned by supervisor after appropriate training.  Interested candidates can share their resumes to Pooja.Thakkar@arcolab.com with Subject line Sr. Executive - Microbiology

column2: Are you interested in a fulfilling world class career in the Food Industrial Segment ?    Our Client, established in 2010, has shaken the market with traditional Indian drinks. The idea of selling traditional drinks packaged was one of the most innovative ideas in the Indian market and it is today among the fastest growing brands in the FMCG space.          As a   Microbiologist  , you will be responsible for effective implementation of GLP, Safety, GDP and other norms.              What you will do:            Responsible for testing and analysis as per documented procedures/methods for beverage making    Responsible for compilation and reporting of analysis results.    Responsible for calibration of equipments and instruments as per SOP in microbiology.    Responsible for maintaining housekeeping practices as per the requirement of GLP.    Responsible for achieving the documented quality objectives of the laboratory.    Performing laboratory analysis on all materials after appropriate sterilization.    Performing tests on all incoming ingredients and documents all records.    Developing and preparing documents for all protocols.    Developing and documenting various microbiology laboratory processes and preparing final reports.    Conducting quality control tests. Testing quality of materials or finished products.    Maintaining laboratory instruments to ensure proper working order and troubleshooting malfunctions when needed.       Required Candidate profile What you need to have: Candidate with experience as a Microbiologist in Beverages industry. Must have involved in physical and microbiological tests of the product. At least 6 months experience in similar position and industry Good communication skills, report making and presentation ability Expert knowledge and certification of quality procedures

column2: Product Development: Work on the creation of new food products or the improvement of existing ones     This involves experimenting with ingredients, flavors, textures, and formulations to develop appealing and marketable products     Quality Control: Monitor and assess the quality and safety of food products through various analytical and sensory testing methods     Ensure products meet regulatory standards and quality specifications     Food Testing: Conduct laboratory tests and analyses on food samples to check for factors such as nutritional content, microbiological safety, chemical composition, and sensory attributes (taste, texture, aroma)     Regulatory Compliance: Stay updated on food safety regulations and ensure that food products meet all legal requirements, labeling regulations, and health standards     Microbiological Analysis: Examine food samples for the presence of pathogens, spoilage microorganisms, and other contaminants to ensure food safety     Chemical Analysis: Conduct chemical analyses to determine the composition and content of nutrients, additives, preservatives, and other chemical compounds in food products     Sensory Evaluation: Organize sensory panels or consumer taste tests to assess the taste, texture, color, and aroma of food products     Use this information to make improvements     Shelf-Life Testing: Evaluate and determine the shelf life of food products by monitoring their stability and quality over time
column11: Food Analyst, Testing

Provide technical training to juniors.    Method development /validation as and when required for testing of new parameters /new samples.?
